Key Arguments: The bill is seen as government censorship and a move towards totalitarianism.
It undermines democracy by controlling information and stifling free speech.
The exclusion of government and professional news content from misinformation accountability is hypocritical.
The bill lacks an appeal process for decisions made by ACMA.
The legislation is viewed as harmful to democratic processes and open debate.
Main Themes: Threat to democracy and free speech
Notable Quotes: The Bill, despite the political rhetoric, is nothing short of government censorship.
This a key feature of totalitarianism.
Shame on any bureaucrat that assists this undemocratic, anti-Australian law to pass.
This condescending, dictatorial piece of legislation is an affront to our democracy and collective intelligence.
